perturbation.original_text: 5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within              ----------------- thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within              ----------------- sixty (60) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment schedule. The original text specifies payments within 30 days. This edit extends the payment deadline to 60 days, creating ambiguity regarding the correct due date.

perturbation.original_text: 3.     Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before fifteen (15) days             -------------- after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.changed_text: 3.     Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before forty-five (45) days             -------------- after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates an in-text contradiction. Here, payments are due in 15 days after the end of the month but in the previous edit, in section 5.7, the payments were due in 60 days after the end of each calender quarter.

perturbation.original_text: 5.8     Records.  SpinRecords.com  agrees to keep accurate books of account              ------- and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than seven (7) business  days,  but in no event more than once per year (unless the immediately preceding  audit  showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right, subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such books of account and records which support each statement for at least two years after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  later.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.8     Records.  SpinRecords.com  agrees to keep accurate books of account              ------- and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than fourteen (14) business  days,  but in no event more than once per year (unless the immediately preceding  audit  showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right, subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such books of account and records which support each statement for at least one year after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  later.
perturbation.explanation: This edit introduces a contradiction in the notice period for audits and the retention period for financial records. The original text specifies a notice of seven business days for audits and a two-year retention period for records. This edit changes these to fourteen business days and one year, respectively. Now, if there is a clause mentioning these time periods, they will be in conflict, leading to confusion.
